intro: Biarum tenuifolium subsp. tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. Native to the eastern United States, this perennial herb thrives in moist, woodland environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its delicate appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
